title: Email Not Completely Deleted after Deleting an account

profile.name: Semmle
profile.about: Semmle's engineering analytics platform helps leading technology companies and open-source developers build secure, reliable software.

vulnerability_information:
**Description:** 
If one of the user deletes their account it should be fully deleted in account while semmle doesnt delete it completely.

## Steps To Reproduce:
* Register email1
* After registering, confirm your account.
* once email1 is confirmed. add another email which we will name as email2
* Now Verify the email of email2.
* Delete account of email1 completely
* Now register email2
* after registering email2, confirm the account of email2
* after confirming with the link given in email2 it will automatically logged in and you will notice that email1 and email2 is in there and no need confirmation for email1.

**Fix/Remediation**
As per the rules, once you delete your data in an account it should be completely deleted. it should be another life for an account.

## Impact

User know that after deleting account to semmle, their data will be lost to semmle's database however, it still there which is a privacy violation.

activities.message:
Thank you for bearing with us whilst we considered the issues surrounding this issue.

We have considered the issue and decided that there is no direct information leakage here: the links between email addresses becomes part of the data that we use to attribute contributions, so becomes data in the public domain. (Incidentally, these links might be created other than as explicit user input, so we would not be able to reliably
remove that linkage as part of an account deletion.)

That said, we could indeed make this clearer, so we will update the guidance text on the email address form and account deletion page. As such, we will make this issue as informative, and offer you a bonus to reflect
the fact that we are able to make a non-security related improvement as a result of your report.
